newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony to invest 10 bln yen in JSkyB - Jiji.
newsitem.headline: Sony to invest 10 bln yen in JSkyB - Jiji.

text.p: Sony Corp will invest 10 billion yen in Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB), a satellite broadcasting venture between Softbank Corp and media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's News Corp, Jiji news agency reported on Wednesday.
Jiji said that the three firms had agreed that each will have an equal stake in the venture.
However, a Sony spokesman said the company's stake in JSkyB has not been decided.
"We have been discussing our participation as an equal partner, but it has not been finalised, the spokesman said.
JSkyB is scheduled to start beaming 12 channels into Japan in April, and plans to increase the number to 150 channels by April 1998.

A Softbank spokesman said earlier that the three were considering Sony's capital participation in the venture as well as a possible role for it in providing audiovisual software and broadcasting equipment.
